How to Get Voter Data in Michigan

November 17, 2025 michigan voter-data voter-list voter-history

Michigan provides access to voter registration data through Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests at an exceptionally low cost. Estimated between $23-$50 for statewide data, Michigan offers one of the most affordable voter data systems in the United States through its public records framework.

Quick Summary

Category Details
Statewide Cost $23-$50 (estimated)
Voter List Access FOIA request
Voter History Access Selectable option on form
Delivery Method Flash drive or FTP
Processing Time Subject to FOIA timelines

Voter List

Michigan provides voter registration data through Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests submitted to the Secretary of State’s office.

How to Access

  1. Download the Michigan FOIA Form PDF
  2. Complete the FOIA request form
  3. Specify statewide voter registration data
  4. Check the voter history option if desired
  5. Select delivery method (flash drive or FTP)
  6. Submit the form via email to the address specified
  7. Pay applicable FOIA fees when invoiced
  8. Receive voter data via your selected delivery method

What’s Included

The voter registration file includes comprehensive information for all registered voters in Michigan.

Voter History

Michigan offers voter history as a selectable option on the FOIA request form.

How to Access

When completing the FOIA form, check the box or option to include voter history data with your voter registration request.

Historical Coverage

Contact the Secretary of State or review the FOIA form for details about the historical coverage period included in the voter history file.

Cost

Michigan’s voter data is exceptionally affordable through the FOIA process, with estimates ranging from $23 to $50 for statewide data.

This low cost is based on Michigan’s FOIA guidelines, which limit fees to:

  • Actual cost of copying/duplication
  • Media costs (flash drive, etc.)
  • Limited labor charges
  • No profit or excessive fees

Cost Components

Under Michigan FOIA law, agencies may charge for:

  • Cost of media (flash drive if selected)
  • Actual duplication costs
  • Limited staff time (subject to statutory limits)
  • FTP setup if applicable (usually minimal or free)

The $23-$50 estimate reflects these modest allowable costs.

Delivery Methods

Michigan offers two flexible delivery options:

1. Flash Drive

  • Data provided on physical USB flash drive
  • Mailed to your address
  • Small media cost included in total fee
  • No special technical setup required

2. FTP (File Transfer Protocol)

  • Digital delivery via FTP server
  • Faster than physical media
  • May require you to provide FTP server credentials
  • Minimal or no additional cost

Choose the delivery method that best suits your technical capabilities and timeline.

Restrictions and Permitted Uses

Michigan voter data obtained through FOIA requests is subject to:

  • Freedom of Information Act provisions
  • Privacy protections under state law
  • Any applicable restrictions on voter registration data use

When requesting Michigan voter data, users must comply with state laws regarding the use of public records and voter registration information.

Technical Notes

FOIA-Based Access

Michigan’s use of the FOIA framework for voter data access provides several benefits:

Advantages:

  • Minimal cost (FOIA limits fees to actual costs)
  • Transparent fee structure
  • Established legal framework
  • Public oversight

Characteristics:

  • Request-based process
  • Subject to FOIA timelines
  • Email submission accepted
  • Standardized form

FOIA Timeline

Under Michigan FOIA law:

  • Response required within 5 business days
  • Can be extended up to 10 business days with notice
  • Large requests may take longer
  • Timeline starts when request is received

Email Submission

Michigan accepts FOIA requests via email, making the process convenient:

  • No need to mail forms
  • Faster submission
  • Easy to track
  • Quick communication

Exceptional Value

At $23-$50, Michigan offers some of the lowest-cost voter data in the nation:

  • 95%+ less expensive than many states
  • Complete statewide coverage
  • Voter history included
  • Flexible delivery options

This pricing is similar to Arkansas ($2.50) in terms of exceptional affordability.

Voter History Option

The checkbox option for voter history on the FOIA form makes it simple to include historical voting data with your request.

Testing Status

This system has not been independently tested. Recommended approach:

  1. Download and review the FOIA form
  2. Call or email the Secretary of State with questions
  3. Confirm current fees (verify $23-$50 estimate)
  4. Clarify voter history coverage
  5. Choose delivery method
  6. Submit FOIA request via email
  7. Respond promptly to any fee invoice

Contact Information

Michigan Secretary of State

  • Website: https://www.michigan.gov/sos
  • FOIA Form: FOIA Request Form PDF
  • Submission: Via email to address specified on form

Michigan’s FOIA-based voter data access provides exceptional value with estimated costs of just $23-$50 for complete statewide data with voter history. The email submission process, flexible delivery options, and FOIA fee limitations make Michigan one of the most affordable and accessible states for obtaining comprehensive voter registration and participation data.
